description: Post-test for chart to task scenario - assesses learning after tutoring session

questions.question_text: A teacher wants to show which of 6 departments has the highest budget. What analytical task is this and which chart is best?

options.text: Comparison task - use bar or column chart

questions.explanation: Comparing values across departments is a comparison task, best visualized with bars or columns.

questions.question_text: You need to visualize how website conversions changed week-by-week over Q1. What task and chart?

options.text: Trend task - line or area chart

questions.explanation: Showing change over time periods is a trend analysis task, ideal for line or area charts.

questions.question_text: An analyst wants to see the range and distribution of ages in a customer dataset. Which chart family supports this goal?
questions.explanation: Distribution tasks showing spread and range are best served by histograms, box plots, or violin plots.

questions.question_text: Before choosing a chart, what should you clarify about the analytical task?

options.text: The intent: comparison, trend, distribution, composition, or correlation

questions.explanation: Understanding the analytical intent (comparison, trend, etc.) is crucial for selecting an appropriate chart type.
